0: The location is excellent very close to Knightsbridge shops Hyde Park and the tube station for access to other parts of London
The views to the park are amazing
location is really good with close proximity to Hyde Park a variety of shopping areas high end like Harrods but further down on Kings Road you will find hip and young brands like Lululemon etc
My family and I have visited the Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park many times now it is always our choice while staying in London each December
The location is amazing central for shopping and hotel over looks the park
The building is very historical and resides just on the edge of Hyde Park my favorite in all of London
The location is excellent with breakfast overlooking Hyde Park and the Horse Guards trotting past
The doorman Antonio was adorable and even loaned us his top hat to have our photo taken pre Ascot when we had yet to collect our rental hat
Thank you to ALL of the wonderful staff at the Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park for looking after us so well
The reception areas are so warm and welcoming and the modern comfortable updates give the feeling of bringing the beauty of Hyde Park inside
1: We knew the MO would be outstanding and we were not disappointed from the moment we parked outside for the valet parking we had a fantastic experience
2: If I had to describe in a nut shell the welcome I received from the Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park in one word that would befit perfectly
I spent half of my time enjoying the room and the other half at Hyde park which is literally like 5 mins walk away
When we return hopefully sooner than later I definitely would opt for a similar room maybe overlooking Hyde park
Parking is a bit tricky as they do not have a porte cochere but they provide good valet service
the Hyde Park Mandarin Oriental should be at the top of any discerning London traveler

That is I think the reason why hotel guests have no chances to take the tabels with the view as all of them are taken by not hotel guestsTo sum up my advise to those who prefer luxary hotels is to treat Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park as the last resort
The entrance from the hotel straight out to Hyde Park is reserved for the Queen which means it ’s down the grand staircase out the front door and round the corner for everyone else
In the morning you can see people feeding the ducks swan goose and birds at the park
Last but not least it would have been nice to have water and towels available to am runners in the park upon their return similar to other MO properties
We stayed at the MO Hyde Park during Feb school half term as we were going to watch a show with the kids
